title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a White House Task Force to coordinate the federal government's preparations for the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup and the 2026 FIFA World Cup, which the U.S. will host. The Task Force will be led by the President and Vice President and includes key Cabinet members to ensure effective planning and support, focusing on promoting national pride, economic growth, and tourism. The Department of Homeland Security will provide administrative support, and the Task Force will operate until the end of 2026 unless extended.
potential_concerns: Increased transportation demand and security measures may create burdens on urban communities and transportation workers, potentially causing delays and workforce strain before and during the events.
Small business owners and hospitality workers in host cities may see economic benefits but also face challenges such as temporary labor shortages, price gouging, or increased operational pressures.
Coordination across multiple federal agencies may lead to bureaucratic delays that could hinder timely infrastructure improvements critical to safety and transportation accessibility.

Heightened homeland security focus may result in more intrusive screening or surveillance measures impacting residents and visitors, raising privacy and civil liberties concerns within urban communities.

Economic growth from tourism may exacerbate existing inequalities if benefits are unevenly distributed, leaving some urban or low-income populations with increased costs of living but fewer advantages.
